meanings.definition: Of or relating to inscribing or engraving.
meanings.sent1: The inscriptive markings on the stone tablet were ancient and mysterious.
meanings.sent2: The artist used an inscriptive tool to carve his initials into the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The inscriptive patterns on the wall seemed to dance in the flickering candlelight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an inscriptive message of joy etched into his heart.
meanings.sent5: The inscriptive details of the ancient manuscript were carefully preserved for generations to come.

meanings.sent1: The inscriptive pen left a trail of ink on the paper as she wrote.
meanings.sent2: The inscriptive ruler helped him draw straight lines on the page.
meanings.sent3: The inscriptive label on the jar indicated its contents with precision.
meanings.sent4: His words had an inscriptive power that resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The inscriptive nature of the tool made it perfect for etching designs on metal.

meanings.definition: Having the quality of being inscribed or engraved.
meanings.sent1: The inscriptive ring bore the initials of its owner on the inside.
meanings.sent2: The inscriptive monument stood tall, telling the story of a bygone era.
meanings.sent3: The inscriptive memories of childhood played like a movie in her mind.
meanings.sent4: His eyes held an inscriptive gaze that seemed to read her soul.
meanings.sent5: The inscriptive nature of the ancient artifact hinted at its mysterious origins.
